Method Detail

lookAt

public void lookAt(double[] eye,
                   double[] center,
                   double[] up)
Move the camera to the specified eye point and orient the view toward the specified 3D center point with a given up vector. This provides complete camera control.

lookAt

public void lookAt(float[] eye,
                   float[] center,
                   float[] up)

lookAt

public void lookAt(double[] center)
Rotate and refocus the camera at the specified 3D point, but keep the current eye location and up orientation of the camera. This provides a "turn your head and eyes toward an object" behavior. The new up-vector is computed automatically.

lookAt

public void lookAt(float[] center)

lookAt

public void lookAt(double[] eye,
                   double[] center)
Move the camera to the specified eye point and orient the view toward the specified 3D center point. This provides a "move your body to a point in space and look at an object" behavior. The new up-vector is computed automatically.

getEye

public double[] getEye()
Returns the array describing the camera's orientation in the scene. Changing the contents of this array will have an immediate effect on the camera.

getCenter

public double[] getCenter()
Returns the array describing the camera's position in the scene. Changing the contents of this array will have an immediate effect on the camera.

getUp

public double[] getUp()
Returns the array describing the camera's up vector in the scene. Changing the contents of this array will have an immediate effect on the camera.

lookAt

public void lookAt(double[] eye,
                   float[] center)

structureAdded

public void structureAdded(Structure str)
Implements the IViewUpdateNotification interface

Parameters:
str -

structureAdded

protected void structureAdded(Structure str,
                              ChainGeometry.RibbonForm ribbonForm,
                              boolean doAtoms)
Internal response to 'structure added'. Sets default ribbon form and whether or not to set the default atom styles. Set to 'false' if you want to do your own.

Parameters:
str - - the structure added
ribbonForm - - the default ribbon form
doAtoms - - whether or no to do the atom styles.
